name: Ten Days In October Quiz | Famous Dates | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who shouted 'Tierra! Tierra!', about two hours after midnight on 12h October 1492?
questions.explanation:
Rodrigo de Triana.

	Rodrigo de Triana, who has also been called Juan Rodriguez Bermejo, was a sailor on the Pinta. The words he shouted signaled the discovery of the 'New World'.

questions.text: Who was sentenced to death on 25th October 1586?
questions.explanation:
Mary, Queen of Scots.

	The plot of Mary's page, Anthony Babington, to assassinate Elizabeth I was discovered, and Mary who was a prisoner of Elizabeth, was made to stand trial for her part in the plot. She was executed in February of 1587.

questions.text: For what crime was Marie Antoinette guillotined on 16th October 1793?
questions.explanation:
Treason.

	After a failed attempt to flee Paris, the French Royal family was arrested on suspicion of treason. The king was executed in January of 1793, his wife followed him to the guillotine some nine months later.

Pablo Picasso.

	Picasso was his mother's maiden name, Pablo's original name was Ruyz. He was born in Malaga, Spain.

questions.text: Which historical first happened on 6th October 1927?
questions.correct: 'The Jazz Singer', the first movie 'talkie' was released
options: The first shipment of prisioners arrived in Alcatraz
The first television pictures were broadcast from Alexandra Palace in London
The first circum-navigation of the globe by plane began
questions.explanation:
'The Jazz Singer', the first movie 'talkie' was released.

	Starring Al Jolson and May McAvoy, and directed by Alan Crosland, the movie became a landmark in Hollywood history.

questions.text: What gloomy name was given to 29th October 1929?
questions.explanation:
Black Tuesday.

	It was one of the worst days of the Wall Street Crash.

questions.text: What special event took place on 30th October 1974?
options: Pele's first game for the New York Cosmos
questions.explanation:
The Rumble in the Jungle.

	Muhammad Ali met George Foreman in Zaire, in one of boxing's most memorable encounters.

questions.text: Which world leader was assassinated on 6th October 1981?
questions.explanation:
Anwar Sadat.

	The Egyptian President was murdered by his own troops at a military parade, it is thought that it was because of his soft approach towards Israel.

questions.correct: The bombing of the marine barracks in Beirut
options: The start of the Falklands War
The sinking of the 'Herald of Free Enterprise'
questions.explanation:
The bombing of the marine barracks in Beirut.

	Over 240 U.S. Military personnel were killed when a truck loaded with explosives crashed through the gates of the marine barracks in the Lebanese capital.

questions.text: Which world leader was murdered on Halloween 1984?
questions.explanation:
Indira Gandhi, Indian Prime Minister.

	Mrs. Gandhi was shot dead by two of her Sikh body guards in New Delhi.
